oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Eleazor A. Webber to his cousin Allen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing from Camp Dale, Carolina City, N. C., Pvt. Webber, Co. G, 23rd Mass. Inf., USA, wrote his cousin to report that he was in good health and the weather had been nice. Webber was stationed at Bogue Island five miles from Fort Macon, and gave a lengthy description of the island, noting the dense forest, rabbits and four types of snakes. He wrote that Lt. Hammond went on furlough, Lt. Woodbery had been promoted to captain of Co. H., and Sgt. Mitchell was promoted to 2nd Lt. of Co. G.
